Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel with handle root, probably a hydria; exterior: some black preserved on neck, as on sides of handle; on lowest part of handle incised spoked rosette with petals alternating black and added red, above black band (partly fired red) and two confronting lions (only tops of heads and manes in red remaining); incised blob as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 294, no. B278)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0107) (Phase 1)
